question: What is Richard Barton known for?

content.source_1: of Wairarapa's foundation business societies including: Barton was a foundation member of the Tinui-Wahatahi Rifle Club and a member of the Opaki Rifle Club. He was also a mountaineer, with his name given to "Barton's Track" over Mitre Peak in the Tararua Ranges. In 1927 Barton published a compilation of the journals and correspondence of Reverend John Gare Butler, who was his great grand-father. The book was titled ""Earliest New Zealand"" and described Butler's pioneer missionary work in the Bay of Islands from 1819 to 1824 prior to the signing of the Treaty of Waitangi. content.source_2: Richard W. Barton Richard Walker Barton (1800 â€“ March 15, 1859) was a nineteenth-century politician and lawyer from Virginia, USA. Born at "Shady Oak" near Winchester, Virginia, Barton pursued academic studies, studied law and was admitted to the bar. He began his law practice in Winchester. He was a member of the Virginia General Assembly from 1823 to 1824, 1832 to 1835 and in 1839. He was elected a Whig to the United States House of Representatives in 1840, serving from 1841 to 1843, being unsuccessful for reelection in 1842. Afterwards, Barton resume practicing law in Winchester, Virginia until his
content.source_3: John Gatrell as Sir Richard Marley. The 32x15 minutes episodes were transmitted by most of the ITV network on Saturdays and Sundays between January and April 1979. Southern, however, screened the show across consecutive nights from Mondays through to Thursday in the radio series' original timeslot of 6.45 to 7.00pm. The complete series was released on DVD in March 2009, and in 2010 reruns of "Dick Barton" were shown on the British satellite television channel Film 24. content.source_4: Rich Barton Richard Barton (born June 2, 1967) is an American former Microsoft executive and founder of online travel company (and Microsoft spinoff) Expedia, Inc., real-estate internet company Zillow, and job search engine and career community Glassdoor. He also founded the online travel photography sharing site Trover, which was acquired by Expedia in 2016. Barton is also a venture partner at Benchmark and is on the board of directors for Netflix, Avvo, RealSelf, Nextdoor and Artsy.
